channel.title: Need help Moving NPCS& Editing Client
channel.description:
Hello,
Im really new at this RS PS server devolpment but im a quick learner!
Can anyone show me how i can move NPC'S from one place to another
For example if i want to move a npc from Cor. 1 1 to Cor 2 2
Please be detailed!
**EDIT And i had one more question!!
How do i edit on a CLIENT on the top left where it says ''File''
When you click it .. it says Vote , Donate , Website... How do i edit that so when people click on it they go to my website..

item.title: Need help Moving NPCS& Editing Client
item.dc:creator: @TooFamous TooFamous
item.description:
@TooFamous wrote:

i dont have those in my source autospawner.cfg or npc-süawn.cfg thats the problem …

the only thing i found is NPC handler and theres nothing there like ‘‘spawn = 8 3261 3428 0 0 0 0 0 1 Varrock Thief’’ (example)

lol help ? =/

Read full topic
item.source: Need help Moving NPCS& Editing Client

item.title: Need help Moving NPCS& Editing Client
item.dc:creator: @ethanhello ethanhello
item.description:
@ethanhello wrote:

if you have a config file go in that and find autospawner.cfg you can move npc’s from there

you should have something like this

spawn = 8 3261 3428 0 0 0 0 0 1 Varrock Thief

The “8” is the NPC ID e.g. 1 is man

You can google the Id’s, The 3261 is your x coord and 3428 is your y coord, edit them to edit where your n spawns
To get the coords of where you want them, stand in the position you want and use ::mypos

Read full topic
item.source: Need help Moving NPCS& Editing Client

item.title: Need help Moving NPCS& Editing Client
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“TooFamous, post:3, topic:433929”]Didnt find npc-spawn.cfg and theres no commands ::mypos

and im not sure u understand me…

I just want to move a NPC from one place to another
Exmple:: A Npc is in Varrock and i want to move it to falidor???

How do i do that?[/quote]
What I told you is correct however you’d just find the npc id and location and jsut change the co-ords… This is correct if its pi unless its been changed which i doubt.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help Moving NPCS& Editing Client
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

npc-spawn.cfg config I think. type in game ::mypos to find your co-ords and height and follow the format in the cfg file and enter the correct npc id, co-ords, height hp too i think.

Read full topic
